Kasus Ujaran Idiot, Hukuman Ahmad Dhani Dipangkas Tinggal 3 Bulan
07 Nov 2019, 18:25 by Tempo.co, Kukuh S. Wibowo
TEMPO.CO, Surabaya-Pengacara Dhani Ahmad Prasetyo alias Ahmad Dhani, Aldwin Rahardian, mengaku belum menerima petikan putusan banding atas kliennya dari Pengadilan Tinggi Surabaya dalam kasus penghinaan dan pencemaran nama baik melalui media sosial.
Aldwin berujar akan mengambil petikan putusan yang menyatakan bahwa hukuman pentolan grup Dewa 19 itu dipangkas hingga tinggal hanya 3 bulan dengan masa percobaan 6 bulan. Sebelumnya pada 11 Juni 2019 lalu majelis hakim Pengadilan Negeri Surabaya menjatuhkan hukumaan 1 tahun penjara kepada Ahmad Dhani.
Atas vonis itu Ahmad Dhani mengajukan upaya banding. Meski menguatkan putusan pengadilan tingkat pertama, namun majelis hakim pengadilan tingkat banding yang diketuai PH Hutabarat menerima banding tersebut dan memotong 9 bulan hukuman Ahmad Dhani. Putusan tersebut diketahui dari laman Sistem Informasi Penelusuran Perkara Pengadilan Negeri Surabaya pada Rabu, 6 November.
Majelis hakim banding menyatakan hukuman pidana 3 bulan itu tak perlu dijalani Ahmad Dhani. Kecuali jika di kemudian hari ada putusan hakim yang menentukan lain disebabkan terdakwa melakukan suatu tindak pidana sebelum masa percobaan 6 bulan berakhir.
Ihwal putusan pengadilan banding yang mengkorting hukuman kliennya, Aldwin menghormati putusan hakim. “Besok (hari ini) saya berencana mengambil petikan putusannya,” kata Aldwin saat dihubungi Tempo, Kamis malam, 7 November 2019.
Kasus Ahmad Dhani berawal saat ia gagal memimpin deklarasi #2019GantiPresiden di Tugu Pahlawan Surabaya pada 26 Agustus 2018. Dhani tak bisa keluar dari tempatnya menginap di Hotel Majapahit, Jalan Tunjungan, Surabaya, karena dikepung massa Koalisi Elemen Bela NKRI.
Untuk melampiaskan kekecewaanya, Ahmad Dhani membuat vlog mengecam pengepungan itu. Dhani mengucapkan kata-kata idiot yang ditujukan kepada massa. Ucapan Dhani yang tersebar melalui media sosial itu kemudian dilaporkan ke Polda Jawa Timur oleh perwakilan Koalisi Elemen Bela NKRI.
text:
Case of Idiot Examination, Sentence Ahmad Dhani Trimmed Only 3 Months
Nov 7 2019, 18:25 by Tempo.co, Kukuh S. Wibowo
TEMPO.CO, Surabaya - Lawyer of Dhani Ahmad Prasetyo alias Ahmad Dhani, Aldwin Rahardian, claimed not to have received an excerpt from the Surabaya High Court in the case of insult and defamation through social media.
Aldwin said he would take a verdict stating that the sentence for the Dewa 19 group frontman was reduced to only 3 months with a trial period of 6 months. Earlier on 11 June 2019, the Surabaya District Court panel of judges handed down a 1-year prison sentence to Ahmad Dhani.
Upon the verdict Ahmad Dhani submitted an appeal. Despite upholding the verdict of the first court, the appellate court judge chaired by PH Hutabarat accepted the appeal and cut Ahmad Dhani's 9-month sentence. The decision was made known from the Surabaya District Court's Case Tracking Information System page on Wednesday, November 6.
The appeals panel of judges stated that Ahmad Dhani's 3-month criminal sentence was unnecessary. Unless there is a judge's decision in the future which determines otherwise because the defendant committed a crime before the 6 month probation period ends.
Regarding the verdict of the appellate court which sort out the sentence of his client, Aldwin respected the judge's decision. "Tomorrow (today) I plan to take an excerpt from the decision," Aldwin said when contacted by Tempo, Thursday night, November 7, 2019.
Ahmad Dhani's case began when he failed to lead the declaration of # 2019GantiPresiden at Tugu Pahlawan Surabaya on August 26, 2018. Dhani could not get out of his place to stay at the Majapahit Hotel, Jalan Tunjungan, Surabaya, because he was surrounded by the mass of the Bela NKRI Elemental Coalition.
To vent his disappointment, Ahmad Dhani vlogged the siege. Dhani uttered idiot words addressed to the masses. Dhani's remarks were spread through social media and then reported to the East Java Regional Police by representatives of the Republic of Indonesia Defense Elementary Coalition.
